coredata.dc:title: Graphlet counting
coredata.prism:publicationName: 17th Conference on Applied Mathematics, APLIMAT 2018 - Proceedings
coredata.dc:publisher: Slovak University of Technology in Bratislava

abstract.publishercopyright: © 2018 Slovak University of Technology in Bratislava. All rights reserved.
abstract.ce:para: Graphlet analysis describes a graph's topology by observing frequencies of 4-or 5-node induced subgraphs (graphlets) in the graph. We developed a graphlet counting approach based on a system of linear equations that relate the graphlet counts. For sparse large networks, such as those appearing in bioinformatics, the resulting algorithm is an order of magnitude faster than the existing approaches.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2018 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

For sparse large networks, such as those appearing in bioinformatics, the resulting algorithm is an order of magnitude faster than the existing approaches.
